summary: Email correspondence between legal parties regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's response to motions to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena. The email includes an attached court order and discusses procedural timing for a potential reply.

persons.name: Sabina Mariella
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email discussing Maxwell's response to a subpoena and inquiring about reply timing.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email discussing Maxwell's response to a Rule 17(c) subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the email; her legal team filed a response to motions to quash a Rule 17 subpoena.

connections.description: Both are recipients of legal correspondence regarding the Maxwell case, likely working on the same legal team or as co-counsel.
Mariella is involved in legal proceedings concerning Maxwell's response to a subpoena, likely as opposing counsel or a party to the case.
McCawley is involved in legal proceedings concerning Maxwell's response to a subpoena, likely as opposing counsel or a party to the case.

events.title: Court order on Rule 17 subpoenas
events.description: The court issued an order regarding Rule 17 subpoenas, attached to the email.

events.title: Maxwell's response to motions to quash subpoena
events.description: Maxwell's legal team filed a response to motions to quash her Rule 17(c) subpoena.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team filed a response to motions to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena on November 22, 2021.
The court had already issued an order regarding Rule 17 subpoenas, which was attached to the email correspondence.
The email discusses procedural timing for a potential reply to Maxwell's response, indicating ongoing legal maneuvering.
The correspondence involves Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, indicating federal prosecution involvement.
The email is marked as confidential and subject to attorney-client privilege protections.
